acceptOwnership().details: The new owner accepts the ownership transfer.

deposit().details: Value deposited is msg.value and it is credited to the account of msg.sender.

depositStake(uint256).details: Before calling this method, the account owner must approve the contract as an allowed spender.

depositStakeWithPermit(uint256,uint256,u.details: This method requires a valid EIP-712 signature from the account owner.

params.assessorReceipt: The Assessor's guest fulfillment information verified to confirm the request's requirements are met.
params.fill: The fulfillment information, including the journal and seal.

lockRequest((uint256,(bytes32,(address,u.details: This method should be called from the address of the prover.

lockRequestWithSignature((uint256,(bytes.details: This method uses the provided signature to authenticate the prover.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pendingOwner().details: Returns the address of the pending owner.

params.assessorReceipt: The Assessor's guest fulfillment information verified to confirm the request's requirements are met.
The Assessor's guest fulfillment information verified to confirm the request's requirements are met.
The Assessor's guest fulfillment information verified to confirm the request's requirements are met.
The Assessor's guest fulfillment information verified to confirm the request's requirements are met.

priceRequest((uint256,(bytes32,(address,.details: When called within the same transaction, this method can be used to fulfill a request that is not locked. This is useful when the prover wishes to fulfill a request, but does not want to issue a lock transaction e.g. because the stake is too high or to save money by avoiding the gas costs of the lock transaction.

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC-1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

requestDeadline(uint256).details: If the request is not locked, this function will revert.

returns._0: The expiration time of the request.
True if the request is fulfilled, false otherwise.

requestIsLocked(uint256).details: When a request is locked, only the prover it is locked to can be paid to fulfill the job.

returns._0: True if the request is locked, false otherwise.

requestIsSlashed(uint256).details: Note it is possible for a request to result in a slash, but still be fulfilled if for example another prover decided to fulfill the request altruistically. This function should not be used to determine if a request was fulfilled.

returns._0: True if the request resulted in the prover being slashed, false otherwise.

requestLockDeadline(uint256).details: If the request is not locked, this function will revert.

returns._0: The expiration time of the lock on the request.

slash(uint256).details: The provers stake has already been transferred to the contract when the request was locked.      This method just burn the stake.

submitRequest((uint256,(bytes32,(address.details: Submitting the transaction only broadcasts it, and is not a required step. This method does not validate the signature or store any state related to the request. Verifying the signature here is not required for protocol safety as the signature is checked when the request is locked, and during fulfillment (by the assessor).

submitRoot(address,bytes32,bytes).details: Consider using `submitRootAndFulfillBatch` to submit the root and fulfill in one transaction.

params.seal: The seal of the new merkle root.
params.setVerifier: The address of the set-verifier contract.

submitRootAndFulfillBatch(address,bytes3.details: Useful to reduce the transaction count for fulfillments.

params.assessorReceipt: The Assessor's guest fulfillment information verified to confirm the request's requirements are met.
params.seal: The seal of the new merkle root.
params.setVerifier: The address of the set-verifier contract.

submitRootAndFulfillBatchAndWithdraw(add.details: Useful to reduce the transaction count for fulfillments.

params.assessorReceipt: The Assessor's guest fulfillment information verified to confirm the request's requirements are met.
params.seal: The seal of the new merkle root.
params.setVerifier: The address of the set-verifier contract.

transferOwnership(address).details: Starts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one. Can only be called by the current owner. Setting `newOwner` to the zero address is allowed; this can be used to cancel an initiated ownership transfer.

upgradeToAndCall(address,bytes).details: Upgrade the implementation of the proxy to `newImplementation`, and subsequently execute the function call encoded in `data`. Calls {_authorizeUpgrade}. Emits an {Upgraded} event.

params.assessorReceipt: The Assessor's guest fulfillment information verified to confirm the request's requirements are met.
The Assessor's guest fulfillment information verified to confirm the request's requirements are met.
params.fill: The fulfillment information, including the journal and seal.

withdrawFromStakeTreasury(uint256).details: Value is debited from the market's account.

withdrawFromTreasury(uint256).details: Value is debited from the market's account.

FULFILL_MAX_GAS_FOR_VERIFY().notice: In order to fulfill a request, the prover must provide a proof that can be verified with at most the amount of gas specified by this constant. This requirement exists to ensure the client can then post the given proof in a new transaction as part of the application.

MARKET_FEE_BPS().notice: When an order is fulfilled, the market takes a fee based on the price of the order. This fraction is multiplied by the price to decide the fee.

SLASHING_BURN_BPS().notice: When a prover is slashed for failing to fulfill a request, a portion of the stake is burned, and the remaining portion is either send to the prover that ultimately fulfilled the order, or to the market treasury. This fraction controls that ratio.

balanceOf(address).notice: Check the deposited balance, in Ether, of the given account.

balanceOfStake(address).notice: Check the deposited balance, in HP, of the given account.

deposit().notice: Deposit Ether into the market to pay for proof.

depositStake(uint256).notice: Deposit stake into the market to pay for lockin stake.

depositStakeWithPermit(uint256,uint256,u.notice: Permit and deposit stake into the market to pay for lockin stake.

fulfill((uint256,bytes32,bytes32,bytes,b.notice: Fulfill a request by delivering the proof for the application. If the order is locked, only the prover that locked the order may receive payment. If another prover delivers a proof for an order that is locked, this method will revert unless `paymentRequired` is set to `false` on the `Fulfillment` struct.

fulfillAndWithdraw((uint256,bytes32,byte.notice: Fulfill a request by delivering the proof for the application and withdraw from the prover balance. If the order is locked, only the prover that locked the order may receive payment. If another prover delivers a proof for an order that is locked, this method will revert unless `paymentRequired` is set to `false` on the `Fulfillment` struct.

fulfillBatch((uint256,bytes32,bytes32,by.notice: Fulfills a batch of requests. See IBoundlessMarket.fulfill for more information.

fulfillBatchAndWithdraw((uint256,bytes32.notice: Fulfills a batch of requests and withdraw from the prover balance. See IBoundlessMarket.fulfill for more information.

imageInfo().notice: Returns the assessor imageId and its url.

lockRequest((uint256,(bytes32,(address,u.notice: Lock the request to the prover, giving them exclusive rights to be paid to fulfill this request, and also making them subject to slashing penalties if they fail to deliver. At this point, the price for fulfillment is also set, based on the reverse Dutch auction parameters and the block at which this transaction is processed.

lockRequestWithSignature((uint256,(bytes.notice: Lock the request to the prover, giving them exclusive rights to be paid to fulfill this request, and also making them subject to slashing penalties if they fail to deliver. At this point, the price for fulfillment is also set, based on the reverse Dutch auction parameters and the block at which this transaction is processed.

priceAndFulfill((uint256,(bytes32,(addre.notice: A combined call to `IBoundlessMarket.priceRequest` and `IBoundlessMarket.fulfill`. The caller should provide the signed request and signature for each unlocked request they want to fulfill. Payment for unlocked requests will go to the provided `prover` address.

priceAndFulfillAndWithdraw((uint256,(byt.notice: A combined call to `IBoundlessMarket.priceRequest` and `IBoundlessMarket.fulfillAndWithdraw`. The caller should provide the signed request and signature for each unlocked request they want to fulfill. Payment for unlocked requests will go to the provided `prover` address.

priceAndFulfillBatch((uint256,(bytes32,(.notice: A combined call to `IBoundlessMarket.priceRequest` and `IBoundlessMarket.fulfillBatch`. The caller should provide the signed request and signature for each unlocked request they want to fulfill. Payment for unlocked requests will go to the provided `prover` address.

priceAndFulfillBatchAndWithdraw((uint256.notice: A combined call to `IBoundlessMarket.priceRequest` and `IBoundlessMarket.fulfillBatchAndWithdraw`. The caller should provide the signed request and signature for each unlocked request they want to fulfill. Payment for unlocked requests will go to the provided `prover` address.

priceRequest((uint256,(bytes32,(address,.notice: Validates the request and records the price to transient storage such that it can be fulfilled within the same transaction without taking a lock on it.

requestDeadline(uint256).notice: For a given locked request, returns when request expires.

requestIsFulfilled(uint256).notice: Check if the given request has been fulfilled (i.e. a proof was delivered).

requestIsLocked(uint256).notice: Check if the given request has been locked (i.e. accepted) by a prover.

requestIsSlashed(uint256).notice: Check if the given request resulted in the prover being slashed (i.e. request was locked in but proof was not delivered)

requestLockDeadline(uint256).notice: For a given locked request, returns when the lock expires.

requestLocks(uint256).notice: Mapping of request ID to lock-in state. Non-zero for requests that are locked in.

slash(uint256).notice: When a prover fails to fulfill a request by the deadline, this method can be used to burn the associated prover stake.

submitRequest((uint256,(bytes32,(address.notice: Submit a request such that it is publicly available for provers to evaluate and bid on. Any `msg.value` sent with the call will be added to the balance of `msg.sender`.

submitRoot(address,bytes32,bytes).notice: Submit a new root to a set-verifier.

submitRootAndFulfillBatch(address,bytes3.notice: Combined function to submit a new root to a set-verifier and call fulfillBatch.

submitRootAndFulfillBatchAndWithdraw(add.notice: Combined function to submit a new root to a set-verifier and call fulfillBatchAndWithdraw.

verifyBatchDelivery((uint256,bytes32,byt.notice: Verify the application and assessor receipts for the batch, ensuring that the provided fulfillments satisfy the requests.

verifyDelivery((uint256,bytes32,bytes32,.notice: Verify the application and assessor receipts, ensuring that the provided fulfillment satisfies the request.

withdrawFromStakeTreasury(uint256).notice: Withdraw funds from the market' stake treasury.

withdrawFromTreasury(uint256).notice: Withdraw funds from the market's treasury.

 most the amount of gas specified by this constant. This requirement exists to ensure the
 client can then post the given proof in a new transaction as part of the application.
